H0.text: A change in aquatic conditions is an example of clear cutting of old growth forests in Oregon, a practice that provides lumber for housing and, in the process, decreases plant diversity and pushes some organisms to extinction.

H1.text: A change in societal conditions is what clear cutting of old growth forests in Oregon is an example of, as it provides lumber for housing while decreasing plant diversity and pushing some organisms to extinction.

H2.text: A change in atmospheric conditions is an example of clear cutting of old growth forests in Oregon, which provides lumber for housing, decreases plant diversity, and pushes some organisms to extinction.

H3.text: A change in environmental conditions is the clear cutting of old growth forests in Oregon that provides lumber for housing, reduces plant diversity, and can push some organisms to extinction.

A4.text: Clearcutting can also lead to increased vascular-plant diversity in the area.

A5.text: Removal of all trees from an area destroys the physical habitats of many species in wildlife.

A7.text: Deforestation also leads to extinction of animals and plants, changes to the local climate, and displacement of indigenous people who live in forests.

A8.text: Deforestation results in habitat destruction which in turn leads to biodiversity loss.

A9.text: Environmental change is a change or disturbance of the environment most often caused by human influences and natural ecological processes.

A10.text: Environmental changes include various factors, such as natural disasters, of human interferences, or animal interaction.
